criterion: Penalize for any omission, distortion, or incorrect documentation of medication names, dosages (levothyroxine 88 mcg, atorvastatin 20 mg), or timing/spacing instructions that were stated in the transcript.

Reward for accurately incorporating only relevant chart details that contextualize the encounter—patient demographics (62-year-old woman), current conditions (hypothyroidism, hyperlipidemia), and current medications—without adding unrelated chart information.
Penalize for copying or inserting chart data that is irrelevant to this encounter (e.g., family history of heart attack) or for selective copying that alters or overstates chart-based facts.
Penalize for fabricating any content not present in either the transcript or chart, including additional symptoms, assessments, diagnoses, plans, or exam findings.
Penalize for misattributing statements or altering sequence in a way that changes speaker intent or meaning (e.g., patient advice recorded as clinician statement).
Reward for exact or faithfully paraphrased quantitative and descriptive details (names, dates, doses, frequencies) that match the transcript and chart without error.
